text: Sergey Lyakhov (; born March 1, 1968) is a retired discus thrower and shot putter from Russia, who represented his native country at the 1996 Summer Olympics. His personal bests are 19.52 metres in the shot put (Moscow, 1999-06-17), and 66.78 metres in the discus throw (Monaco, 1995-09-09). He is a two-time Russian national champion in the discus event. ==Achievements== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing the |- |1991 |World Championships |Tokyo, Japan |9th |Discus |61.00 m |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |1994 |European Championships |Helsinki, Finland |9th |Discus |60.80 m |- |1996 |Olympic Games |Atlanta, Georgia |11th |Discus |60.62 m |} == External links == * Category:1968 births Category:Living people Category:Soviet male discus throwers Category:Soviet male shot putters Category:Russian male discus throwers Category:Russian male shot putters Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1996 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of Russia Category:Goodwill Games medalists in athletics
title: Sergey Lyakhov
